"The Voice Within" is the fifth and final single from Christina Aguilera&#039;s second album, Stripped. Released in 2003, the single peaked at #33 on the Billboard Hot 100, becoming Aguilera&#039;s 11th Top 40 hit. The single also peaked at #9 in the UK and #19 in Australia. The single is most known for its simplistic, but critically acclaimed music video that was filmed in black and white as a single continuous camera shot. The video was nominated for three 2004 MTV Video Music Awards, Best Female Video, Viewer&#039;s Choice, and Best Cinematography. For reasons unknown, the song was only included as a bonus track for Aguilera&#039;s greatest hits album Keeps Gettin&#039; Better ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ A Decade of Hits, despite placing higher on the US Hot 100 than "Dirrty", which is included.

The song&#039;s music video was directed by David LaChapelle. It opens with a close-up of Aguilera and zooms out to her wearing a slip and sitting in an abandoned prop room. In one continuous black-and-white shot, Aguilera walks through several rooms, exits the building, and finally lays on a light box. The video was filmed at a deserted theater in downtown Los Angeles, California. It is inspired by neorealist works.

"The Voice Within&#039;" was the eleventh video for Aguilera to appear on TRL. The video hit number one twice and spent thirty-seven days on the countdown.
